intro: Evacidium atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic evaporation plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Atlantic Ocean. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale blue. The plant has adapted to saline environments, with specialized structures that help it retain moisture and filter out excess salt. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, allowing it to store water efficiently. Evacidium atlanticum plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
